title: Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) Page Content ​​​​ The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) closed on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa. You might be able to apply for the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details The length of your Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) will depend on your individual circumstances and those of your employer. Your visa cannot last any longer than the length of the posting of your current employer. What this visa lets you do Details This visa allows you to: enter Australia temporarily work in the domestic duties in the household of someone who holds a Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995) enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid. Your obligations Details You must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. During your stay in Australia you must: maintain adequate health insurance continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream you were granted meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia. Visa holder obligations Details You must: work only in the household of your employer only work doing domestic duties not work for another person or for yourself not stay in Australia if your employer leaves permanently unless the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has agreed to you staying in Australia seek the agreement of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade if you want to transfer your employment and enter into a new employment agreement in the household of another diplomatic visa holder. Your sponsor’s obligations Details Your sponsor is your employer. They must: provide at least the minimum standards for wages and working conditions under Australian law make sure you leave Australia when your visa ends or when your job finishes, and pay the cost of our travel back to your home country. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426)

Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426)
Page Content

​​​​

​​​​

The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) closed on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa.

The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) closed on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa.

You might be able to apply for theTemporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403).

You might be able to apply for the
Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403)
.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426). It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

The length of your Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) will depend on your individual circumstances and those of your employer.

The length of your Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426) will depend on your individual circumstances and those of your employer.

Your visa cannot last any longer than the length of the posting of your current employer.

Your visa cannot last any longer than the length of the posting of your current employer.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa allows you to:

This visa allows you to:
- enter Australia temporarily
enter Australia temporarily
- work in the domestic duties in the household of someone who holds a Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995)
work in the domestic duties in the household of someone who holds a Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995)
- enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid.
enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

During your stay in Australia you must:

During your stay in Australia you must:
- maintainadequate health insurance
maintain
adequate health insurance
- continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream you were granted
continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream you were granted
- meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.
meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.

#### Visa holder obligations

Visa holder obligations
Details

You must:

You must:
- work only in the household of your employer
work only in the household of your employer
- only work doing domestic duties
only work doing domestic duties
- not work for another person or for yourself
not work for another person or for yourself
- not stay in Australia if your employer leaves permanently unless the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has agreed to you staying in Australia
not stay in Australia if your employer leaves permanently unless the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has agreed to you staying in Australia
- seek the agreement of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade if you want to transfer your employment and enter into a new employment agreement in the household of another diplomatic visa holder.
seek the agreement of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade if you want to transfer your employment and enter into a new employment agreement in the household of another diplomatic visa holder.

### Your sponsor’s obligations

Your sponsor’s obligations
Details

Your sponsor is your employer. They must:

Your sponsor is your employer. They must:
- provide at least the minimum standards for wages and working conditions under Australian law
provide at least the minimum standards for wages and working conditions under Australian law
- make sure you leave Australia when your visa ends or when your job finishes, and pay the cost of our travel back to your home country.
make sure you leave Australia when your visa ends or when your job finishes, and pay the cost of our travel back to your home country.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.
